docs.snippet: The United States suggested Thursday it was open to a "new arrangement" with Iran for peacefully resolving disputes such as Tehran's recent ballistic missile tests, while America's Sunni allies in the Persian Gulf said Iran must stop sending force...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States suggested Thursday it was open to a "new arrangement" with Iran for peacefully resolving disputes such as Tehran's recent ballistic missile tests, while America's Sunni allies in the Persian Gulf said Iran must stop sending forces to Syria and weapons to Yemen if it wants to normalize ties with its neighbors.

headline.main: US Open to 'New Arrangement' on Iran's Missile Tests
headline.print_headline: US Open to 'New Arrangement' on Iran's Missile Tests

docs.snippet: Russian President Vladimir Putin said a friend of his named in the "Panama Papers" leaks had done nothing wrong and spent the money he earned from business on buying expensive musical instruments which he was donating to public institutions....

docs.snippet: The U.S. Senate Banking Committee on Thursday had to postpone its vote to confirm the two nominees to join the Securities and Exchange Commission, after four Democrats created a wall of opposition over the nominees' views of corporate political sp...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Senate Banking Committee on Thursday had to postpone its vote to confirm the two nominees to join the Securities and Exchange Commission, after four Democrats created a wall of opposition over the nominees' views of corporate political spending.

headline.main: Democrats Force Postponement of Committee's Vote on SEC Nominees

docs.snippet: Donald Trump says the Federal Reserve has stoked asset bubbles and backs a congressional review of its decisions. Bernie Sanders also wants to "audit" the Fed to make it less beholden to Wall Street. Ted Cruz calls for a return to a gold standard ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump says the Federal Reserve has stoked asset bubbles and backs a congressional review of its decisions. Bernie Sanders also wants to "audit" the Fed to make it less beholden to Wall Street. Ted Cruz calls for a return to a gold standard abandoned in 1933.

headline.main: Election Stirs Debate About Fed's Handling of Political Pressure
headline.print_headline: Election Stirs Debate About Fed's Handling of Political Pressure

docs.snippet: Mrs. Clinton’s Senate victory was fueled by the unlikely support of white working-class voters there, but she faces new challenges in securing that kind of support again....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton’s Senate victory was fueled by the unlikely support of white working-class voters there, but she faces new challenges in securing that kind of support again.
docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton is looking to appeal to same white working-class voters in upstate New York who propelled her to victory in 2000 Senate race in order to defeat Sen Bernie Sanders in coming presidential primary; win is crucially important to Clinton both on personal level and as showcase of her ability to appeal to voters nationwide, particularly in face of Sanders's economic populism.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Again Looks Upstate for Win in New York
headline.print_headline: New York Region Poses Fresh Test for Clinton Bid

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and THOMAS KAPLAN
